contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Flag | Name = Flag of Somalia | Image = Flag of Somalia.svg | Proportion = 2:3 | Design = A white star centered on a light blue field. | Use = 111111 }} The '''flag of [[Somalia]]''' ({{lang-so|''Calanka Soomaaliya''}}) was adopted on October 12, 1954. It was designed by [[Mohammed Awale Liban]].<ref name="Crwf">[http://www.crwflags.com/fotw/flags/so.html#history History of the flag]</ref><ref name="Tifh">Maria Costantino, The Illustrated Flag Handbook, (Gramercy Books: 2001), p.185.</ref> Upon reunification of [[Italian Somaliland]] and [[British Somaliland]], the flag was used for the nascent [[Somali Republic]]. ==History== The flag of Somalia was created in 1954 during the transitional [[Trust Territory of Somalia|trusteeship]] period of the nation's history. It was personally designed by the Somali scholar Mohammed Awale Liban, after he had been selected by the Somali labour trade union to come up with a design in preparation for independence.<ref name="Crwf"/><ref name="Tifh"/> ==Characteristics== An [[ethnic flag]], the five-pointed white ''Star of Unity'' in its center represents the [[Somali people|Somali]] ethnic group found in [[Djibouti]], the [[Ogaden]] region in [[Ethiopia]], the [[North Eastern Province (Kenya)|North Eastern Province]] in [[Kenya]], and the former British Somaliland and Italian Somaliland territories.<ref name="Wasf">[http://www.worldatlas.com/webimage/flags/countrys/africa/somalia.htm Somalia Flag]</ref><ref name="Cwfbsom">{{cite web|title=The World Factbook - Somalia|url=https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/flags/flagtemplate_so.html|publisher=Central Intelligence Agency|accessdate=22 July 2012}}</ref> The flag's light blue backdrop was originally influenced by the [[flag of the United Nations]], in recognition of the UN's role in Somalia's transition to independence during the trusteeship period.<ref>{{Cite book |last=Znamierowski |first=Alfred |title=The World Encyclopedia of Flags |isbn=0-7548-0167-5 |page=222}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book |last=Talocci |first=Mauro |title=Guide to the Flags of the World |editor-first=Whitney |editor1-last=Smith |editor-link=Whitney Smith |isbn=0-688-01141-1 |page=131}}</ref> However, it today officially denotes the sky as well as the [[Indian Ocean]], which flanks the nation.<ref name="Cwfbsom"/> The flag's [[blazon]], or heraldic description, is: ''[[Azure (heraldry)|Azure]], a mullet [[Argent]]''. ==Construction== The flag of Somalia can be faithfully
